properties.areaDesc: Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu; Manua
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 2:21PM SBT by NWS Pago Pago AS
properties.description:
The monsoonal trough is currently beginning to move north of
American Samoa. Marine observations and model data show that winds
have decreased throughout the day today, however there will be a
few isolated regions along the coastal waters region that may
reach up to 35 knots overnight. Winds are expected to decrease
below gale force for the entire coastal waters region by tomorrow.

Additionally, Tropical Cyclone Sarai has been downgraded to a
depression and it's influence over the American Samoa coastal
waters will also continue to slowly diminish through Wednesday
morning.

Mariners should alter plans to avoid these hazardous conditions.
Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or secure the
vessel for severe conditions. It is highly recommended that
mariners without the proper experience to seek safe harbor prior
to the onset of gale conditions.

Listen to NOAA Weather Radio for the latest updates. You may also
follow us on Facebook "NWSPagoPago" or our website at
www.weather.gov/ppg.

NWSheadline: A Gale Warning continues for the American Samoan coastal waters through early Wednesday morning
